Just an idea I had, where you take a combo fue tank and engine and attach it to your payload, it then tries to adjust its size, fuel content, engine power/number/size to fit that payload and defined altitute requirements.

Perhaps include extra texture sets and models to pick from?

Would this be possible, as in easy for a modder to do in a non-insane amount of time?
Procedural parts has procedural SRBs.

Procedural parts has procedural SRBs.

He's asking for rather more than that - it'd need a KER style calculator to feed back to the part. Conceptually it could be done given the functionality exists, I don't know if anyone would be actually interested in doing it though. Also that doesn't handle multistage lifters - calculating that could probably be done ok too but there's the logistics of handling multiple models.

I'm opposed to the idea in it's entirety as I like building things, but I can see the attraction.

And if you're tired of building a lifter for your payloads- sub-assemblies exist...

Nah, just reduce the number of parts on nonspecific or routine lifters to as few as possible. For example, you might use this to launch that cluster of geo-sync box sats, but you'd probably want a massive custom lifter for that 400t Grand Tour craft.
I would suggest building your lifters as subassemblies and use a welding mod to reduce parts. That is going to be the best option.
